ns0:foreignObject.html:div: Move one square in any direction, and test AGL with DC [This card's priority]. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card. On success, you may set your facing to any direction. Double the DC of the above check to move two squares in a straight line
movement
Move on square in any direction. Set faceing any direction. Next action in this stack gains +1 priority
movement

Target: One forward square
Choose one of:
Deal 1d4 - 2 + STR/2 Damage.
Enemy must make a DC STR-2 STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from you
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'grappled' effect (and you gain the 'grappling' effect), or 'pinned', if they are already grappled

strike
unarmed
Move on square in any direction. Set faceing any direction. Next action in this stack gains +1 priority
movement

Target: One forward square
Choose two of:
Deal 1d4 + STR/2 + TEC/2-1 Damage.
Enemy must make a DC MAX(STR, TEC) + EMP/2 STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from you
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'grappled' effect (and you gain the 'grappling' effect), or 'pinned', if they are already grappled

strike
unarmed

Target: One forward square
Choose two of:
Deal 1d4 + STR/2 + TEC/2-1 Damage.
Enemy must make a DC MAX(STR, TEC) + EMP/2 STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from you
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'grappled' effect (and you gain the 'grappling' effect), or 'pinned', if they are already grappled

strike
unarmed

Target: One forward square
Choose two of:
Deal 1d4 + STR/2 + TEC/2-1 Damage.
Enemy must make a DC MAX(STR, TEC) + EMP/2 STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from you
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'grappled' effect (and you gain the 'grappling' effect), or 'pinned', if they are already grappled

strike
unarmed

Chose a 'strike' attack targeting your square or an adjacent square. Move one square toward the source of the attack. For the purposes of calculating the damage of that attack, subtract a total of your STR + TEC from whichever attributes of the attacker you see fit.
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC [This card's priority]/2. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card. On success, you may set your facing to any direction and move a third space in the same direction.
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC [This card's priority]/2. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card. On success, you may set your facing to any direction and move a third space in the same direction.
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC [This card's priority]/2. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card. On success, you may set your facing to any direction and move a third space in the same direction.
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement
